rubenchristoffer.hetty

Class HTTPNavigator

  • java.lang.Object
    • rubenchristoffer.hetty.HTTPNavigator

  • public class HTTPNavigator
extends java.lang.Object
    HTTPNavigator is a class that builds on top of HTTPConnection (layer 2) and is used for following redirects and will automatically handle cookies for you between each request.
    Author:
    Ruben Christoffer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HTTPNavigator(HTTPConnection con, HTTPRequest req)
      Creates a new HTTPNavigator.

      If you wish to enable debugging, you can set the printstream you want to print output to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPNavigator

        public HTTPNavigator(HTTPConnection con,
                     HTTPRequest req)
        Creates a new HTTPNavigator.
        Parameters:
        con - is the underlying connection (layer 1) the navigator should use
        req - is the initial request that should be sent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if con or req is null

    • Method Detail

      • navigateNext

        public boolean navigateNext()
        Same as navigateNext(boolean) where applyFilters=true
        Returns:
        Refer to navigateNext(boolean)

      • navigateNext

        public boolean navigateNext(boolean applyFilters)
        Sends the current request and waits for a response. When response is received, it will update the new 'current' request using updated cookies if applicable. It will also always reset request method to GET. This can be called even if underlying HTTPConnection (layer 1) is closed, as it will attempt to open the connection if this is the case.
        Parameters:
        applyFilters - determines whether filters should be applied when sending request
        Returns:
        true when there are no more redirects, false otherwise

      • navigateTillEnd

        public void navigateTillEnd(boolean applyFilters)
        Calls navigateNext(boolean) until there are no more redirects left.
        Parameters:
        applyFilters - determines whether filters should be applied when sending request

      • setURL

        public void setURL(java.net.URL url)
        Will call HTTPConnection.setURL(URL) on underlying HTTPConnection, but also update the cookies of current request to match new URL. You should therefore use this method instead of setting the URL of the underlying HTTPConnection directly.
        Parameters:
        url - is the new URL you want to set

      • setDebugOutputStream

        public void setDebugOutputStream(java.io.PrintStream debugOutputStream)
        If you wish to enable debugging, you can set the printstream you want to print output to. Set this to null if you wish to disable debugging. By default debugging is set to false.
        Parameters:
        debugOutputStream - the outputstream you want to print debug messages to

      • getConnection

        public HTTPConnection getConnection()
        Gets underlying HTTPConnection.
        Returns:
        the underlying HTTPConnection (layer 1)

      • getCurrentRequest

        public HTTPRequest getCurrentRequest()
        Gets the current request.
        Returns:
        the current request that should be sent next

      • getLastResponse

        public HTTPResponse getLastResponse()
        The last response received from server.
        Returns:
        the last HTTPResponse received from server

      • getCookieJar

        public HTTPCookieJar getCookieJar()
        Gets the cookie jar used by the navigator to keep track of cookies.
        Returns:
        the HTTPCookieJar used by navigator
